content.question: The second-degree Taylor polynomial for <math alttext="f of x, equals, the fraction with numerator cosine x, and denominator 1 minus x, end fraction " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> about <math alttext="x equals 0 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> is

choices.label: <math alttext="1 plus the fraction with numerator x squared, and denominator 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="1 plus x, plus the fraction with numerator x squared, and denominator 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="1 plus x, plus x squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>
